content:
• Tuesday, October 7, 2014
  • SAVE

    Spirit Airlines sees Q3 operating margin at lower end of guidance

    • Spirit Airlines (NASDAQ:SAVE) -3.2% AH after disclosing its September load factor fell 3.2 points Y/Y and that it sees Q3 adjusted operating margin at the lower half of its previous guidance range.
    • SAVE says September revenue passenger miles rose 13.5% Y/Y on an 18% increase in available seat miles, with a load factor of 81.5%, a decrease of 3.2 points from Sept. 2013.
    • Says it recently became aware of an underpayment of federal excise tax on a minority portion of its fuel purchases beginning in July 2009, and will adjust fuel price calculations accordingly.
    • Based on actual and anticipated results so far in the quarter, SAVE expects Q3 adjusted operating margin will be in the lower half of the company's previous guidance range.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM
  • BHC

    WSJ: Valeant, Pershing to boost Allergan bid by $15/share

    • Valeant (VRX) and Bill Ackman's Pershing Square Capital plan to up their hostile cash/stock bid for Allergan (NYSE:AGN) by $15/share, the WSJ reports. Based on Valeant's Tuesday close, that puts the new offer around $191/share.
    • Valeant/Pershing are still reportedly "ironing out questions of timing and the mix of cash and stock for the additional $15-per-share rise."
    • AGN +2.6% AH to $191.00.
    • Earlier: Allergan asks judge to keep Pershing's stake out of shareholder vote
    • Update (6:15PM): Valeant is up 3.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: UNIS +15.7%. RBCN +4.4%. HERO +4.2%. FBR +2.8%. GSAT +2.5%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TILE -23.0%. GPRO -2.7%. SAVE -2.4%. ARNA -2.3%. BKW -2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • YUM

    YUM! Brands misses by $0.02, misses on revenue

    • YUM! Brands (NYSE:YUM): FQ3 EPS of $0.87 misses by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $3.35B (-3.5% Y/Y) misses by $130M.
    • Shares +1.35% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • GPRO

    GoPro -2.6% AH on Piper downgrade

    • Citing valuation, Piper has cut GoPro (NASDAQ:GPRO) to Neutral after the bell. Its target is still at $90.
    • Shares are at $91.40 in AH trading. After making new highs in the morning, GoPro finished regular trading near breakeven on a day the Nasdaq fell 1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 5 Comments
  • HPQ

    H-P gives back yesterday's gains; Rackspace speculation re-emerges

    • With the Nasdaq falling 1.6%, H-P (HPQ -4.5%) gave back nearly all of the gains it saw yesterday following its split announcement, in spite of largely favorable reactions from the sell-side and others.
    • In addition to arguing H-P could be less efficient as two companies (both due to higher overhead and less negotiating power with suppliers), deal skeptics have argued a breakup doesn't address either half of the company's growth challenges.
    • VC Roger McNamee: "HP has gone from having two boat anchors tied together, each trying to float in the water, to two separate boat anchors trying to float in the waters ... The only thing I’m certain about on this deal is that the executive compensation will be absolutely terrific."
    • Meanwhile, Rackspace (RAX +1.8%) finished higher amid speculation the enterprise IT half of H-P could bid for the company. Rackspace called off its attempts to find a buyer last month, and re/code reported in August H-P is uninterested.
    • Also: H-P has sold its 40% stake in UAE-based IT services firm Injazat Data Systems for an undisclosed sum. With H-P having reportedly attempted to sell its entire IT services unit (among other businesses) before deciding on a breakup, this could be a sign of things to come.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • ALCS

    Heartland throws in the towel on Alco Stores

    • Who's left to sell? Heartland Advisors discloses it's liquidated its stake in Alco Stores (ALCS -2.6%). Heartland at one point had more than 10% ownership in the retail chain.
    • Last month, Michael Price unloaded his stake in Alco.
    • It was roughly one year ago, Alco rejected a $14 per share buyout offer. It's trading at $1.88 today.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • ISSC

    Innovative Solutions -45% as Delta Airlines terminates contract

    • Innovative Solutions (ISSC -44.7%) shares are cut nearly in half after the designer of flight guidance and cockpit display systems says Delta Airlines (NYSE:DAL) has terminated its contract with the company to provide a cockpit upgrade for its fleet of MD88 and MD90 aircraft.
    • ISSC says it is in discussions with DAL regarding the parties' obligations under the contract, which represented ~$62M of its reported backlog as of June 30, 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources downgraded further into junk at S&P

    • S&P downgrades Cliffs Natural Resources' (CLF -5.1%) corporate credit rating to BB- from BBB- with a negative outlook, reflecting the possibility of another downgrade if iron ore prices are sustained at ~$85/ton or lower and credit measures continue to deteriorate.
    • The ratings agency lowers its iron ore price assumptions through 2016, which pushes its leverage estimate for CLF above 6x adjusted debt to EBITDA for next year.
    • CLF shares have now fallen 25% since the first of this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 11 Comments
  • KO

    Investors plays defense with Coca-Cola

    • Shares of Coca-Cola (KO +0.8%) ignore the broad market decline to trade at their highest level since 1998.
    • The stock is a favorite of defensive-minded investors and has benefited with activist investor WIntergreen Advisors making more noise.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 4 Comments
  • RCL

    Cruise stocks slide on Ebola concerns

    • Cruise line stocks are skittish after Carnival canceled stops in West Africa due to concerns over the Ebola virus.
    • Travel industry analysts think the reaction looks a bit overdone with some of the operators being sold off having very little business in Africa.
    • Decliners: Royal Caribbean (NYSE:RCL) -6.4%, Carnival (NYSE:CCL) -4.8%, Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings (NASDAQ:NCLH) -2.5%, Carnival ADRs (NYSE:CUK) -5.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • HLF

    Report: Herbalife expects disciplinary action from FTC, but no shutdown

    • Herbalife (HLF -2.7%) has been under investigation for months about whether it's operating as an illegal pyramid scheme, and senior executives at the company, tell Fox News it's a near-certainty the company will avoid the death penalty, though some action - perhaps a mix of fines and sanctions - remains a distinct possibility.
    • Herbalife insiders note the FTC - when it sees illegal multi-level marketing schemes at work - has moved quickly to shut a number of them in recent years. The fact that no action has yet been taken gives the executives another level of confidence the company will survive.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 60 Comments
  • PBR

    Petrobras surges for second day, also confirms ultra-deepwater discovery

    • Petrobras (PBR +7.1%) and other Brazilian stocks continue to climb higher after Sunday's presidential election resulted in pro-business candidate Aeceo Neves showing surprising strength in making the runoff against incumbent Pres. Rousseff.
    • Also: CIG +9.3%, EBR.B +3.9%, ELP +3.2%, EWZ +2.4%, BBD +2%, VALE +1.8%, ITUB +1.8%.
    • Separately, PBR says its latest well in the Brigadeiro discovery evaluation plan area has confirmed the presence of good quality oil in the ultradeep waters of the Espirito Santo Basin post-salt deposits.
    • PBR, with an 89.9% stake, is the operator of the consortium developing the project.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • CBK

    Weak sales guidance clips Christopher & Banks

    • Shares of Christopher & Bank (CBK -29.5%) plummet after the retailer drops its revenue guidance due to soft traffic trends.
    • The company expects Q3 sales of $114M-$128M vs. $122M-$124M prior and $123.9M consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • PTRY

    The Pantry rallies after issuing peak at FQ4 results

    • The Pantry (PTRY +6.8%) trades higher after reporting preliminary results for FQ4 which appear to set it up for an earnings beat.
    • The company says comparable store merchandise revenue rose 2.5% during the quarter.
    • Retail fuel margin per gallon +$0.023 Y/Y to $0.13.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • HUBB

    Hubbell trustee reportedly mulling sale

    • The trustee of Hubbell's ((HUB.B +2.5%), (HUB.A +5.9%)) controlling family trusts has hired Credit Suisse to evaluate options for it shares, reports Reuters. The move - still in the early stages - follows pressure from another large owner of Hubbell, according to sources.
    • The company had been thought of as a potential takeover target following a number of deals involving electrical equipment makers in 2012.
    • The Class A shares have 20x the voting rights of the Class B, and almost half the Class A shares are owned by the Harvey Hubbell and Louis Roche trusts. Bessemer Trust was appointed in June as the trustee for the two Hubbell family trusts.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • ISR

    IsoRay jumps on report of single surgery

    • Shares of nano cap IsoRay (ISR +31.2%) jump on a 5x surge in volume in response to the company's announcement of positive results from a brain tumor procedure in Peru.
    • A neurosurgeon in Lima implanted a Cesium-131 seed via a stereotactic implant in a seven-year-old girl with an inoperable glioblastoma brain tumor. The 2.7 cm tumor could not be surgically removed because it was too close to the brainstem. Instead, the surgeon implanted a Cesium-131 seed directly into the tumor. Ten weeks later, the tumor had shrunk 70% and the girl was back at school.
    • The announcement didn't include what follow-on treatment the girl will need since the tumor is still there and will likely regrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 12 Comments
  • FKGRX

    New Franklin Growth Fund chief vows to stay the course

    • Serena Perin Vinton took over the $10.5B Franklin Growth Fund (MUTF:FKGRX) in April after the passing of Jerry Palmieri who had overseen the fund since 1965. The fund gained an annualized 5.9% for the fifteen years ended in March vs. 4.5% for the S&P 500 and 3% for its large-cap peers, according to Morningstar.
    • “What makes us unique is our patience and long-term viewpoint," says Perin Vinton of the fund which has a turnover rate of just 1% compared to nearly 70% for the average large-cap growth fund.
    • S&P Capital IQ's Todd Rosenbluth notes concern might be warranted except for the fact that Perin Vinton had been co-manager of the fund along with Palmieri since 2008.
    • While the two have similar styles - both skeptical of bank balance sheets, for instance - Morningstar's Dan Culloton says Perin Vinton will be willing to make room for asset managers and other "less opaque" financial firms.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: GTAT +74%. CTC +57%. ISR +32%. CAMP +23%. LAKE +17%. RXII +16%. EFOI +15%. RBCN +14%. ADHD +12%. CBMX +12%.
    • Top 10 Losers: ISSC -44%. CBK -29%. TCS -23%. SODA -21%. ALTI -20%. ADMS -16%. BIOC -12%. OTIV -11%. AEGN -11%. EZPW -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • OTIV

    On Track -10.3% following shelf filing

    • On Track Innovations (NASDAQ:OTIV) has filed to sell up to $50M worth of stock and warrants through future offerings.
    • CEO Ofer Tziperman: "This shelf registration provides us with efficient and flexible access to the capital markets ... It will also allow us to act quickly in case of a requirement for working capital or to pursue our near and long-term strategic objectives."
    • On Track had $10.6M in cash at the end of June, and $7M in loans outstanding.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • MBI

    MBIA victim of huge data leak

    • MBIA (MBI) has disabled mdiaweb.com after being notified of a breach which exposed "countless" customer account numbers, balances, and other sensitive data, says KrebsOnSecurity. The website contains customer data from Cutwater Asset Management, a fixed-income unit under agreement to be sold to BNY Mellon.
    • Roughly 230 pages of account statements from Cutwater had been indexed by Google amid the leak, including account and routing numbers, balances, dividends, and account holder names for a number of institutional clients.
    • "We have been notified that certain information related to clients of MBIA’s asset management subsidiary, Cutwater Asset Management, may have been illegally accessed,” says a company spokesman.
    • Initially dropping about 1.5% on the report, the stock has returned to flat on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • OLED

    Universal Display slumps following Samsung's warning

    • Universal Display (OLED -2.6%) has sold off after top customer Samsung warned its Q3 sales will be down ~20% Y/Y due to mobile weakness.
    • Samsung, contending with both tough Chinese competition and the iPhone 6 launch, mentioned a declining smartphone ASP took a toll on its results. That suggests sales of the high-end devices (the Galaxy S5, Note 3, etc.) that Universal depends heavily on for OLED materials says may have been particularly soft.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 5 Comments
  • AGCO

    Agco’s warning bodes ill for Deere's earnings outlook, Janney says

    • AGCO (AGCO -7.7%) shares fell as much as 9% after the manufacturer and distributor of agricultural equipment slashed its FQ3 and full-year earnings outlook, saying it expects weak demand across all regions.
    • Deere (DE -1.9%), which caters to a similar clientele, also is falling, and Janney analyst Ryan Connors thinks AGCO’s news significantly increases the likelihood of further earnings downside for DE.
    • While sentiment on agricultural machinery stocks already is very negative, ultimately the trajectory of commodity prices over the next 12 months will determine how the stocks perform, Janney says, which makes visibility on DE poor or even non-existent.
    • Janney also downgrades AGCO to Neutral from Buy, and cuts its target price to $56 from $72.
    • Also: Deere lower on BofA/Merrill downgrade
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • SFUN

    SouFun +3.5% following Century 21 China deal

    • SouFun (NYSE:SFUN) has struck an investment/partnership deal with Century 21 China, declared by the company to be "China's leading real estate franchise company."
    • The deal calls for SouFun and CTC to "form a mutually preferred strategic partnership across their business lines, including advertising, e-commerce, listing service, internet and real estate financing, secondary and new home agency businesses."
    • SouFun will buy a 20% stake in CTC through a private placement, and provide financing for CTC through a convertible bond and a loan. Altogether, SouFun will be providing $51M in capital.
    • In July, SouFun inked similar deals with leading Chinese home agencies World Union and Hopefluent.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • GPRO

    New highs for GoPro; Barclays ups target, still critical of valuation

    • GoPro (GPRO +3.6%) is now up 12% since its Hero4 cameras (along with the entry-level Hero) went on sale on Sunday. Shares are up 238% from a post-IPO opening trade of $28.65.
    • Barclays' Joseph Wolf has hiked his target by $15 to $60 today, while reiterating an Equal-Weight. "Investors either think GoPro is an extraordinary hardware company, or have a high degree of confidence that the media/content strategy could one day generate billions in revenue," Wolf writes, trying to grasp a valuation he remains uncomfortable with.
    • Nonetheless, Wolf thinks the Hero4 launch is going well, and reports "supply chain commentary and [Barclays'] channel checks of Best Buy, Walmart, and Target point to a clean US channel without excess supply."
    • GoPro now goes for 8x 2015E sales and 93x 2015E EPS.
    • Yesterday: GoPro, Ambarella rally after Hero4 launch, bullish notes
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 4 Comments
  • NLY

    Mortgage REITs working as broad market slides and yields drop

    • Sector giants Annaly Capital (NLY +1.2%) and American Capital Agency (AGNC +1%) are pacing gains in the mortgage REIT sector (REM +0.3%) on a day when the major averages are lower by about 0.75% and the 10-year yield at 2.39% has about erased all of its big post-Labor Day gain.
    • Additional ETFs: MORT, MORL
    • Among other names, there's CYS Investments (CYS +0.5%) - whose management has been the most publicly skeptical of the higher interest rates meme.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 11 Comments
  • TWTR

    Twitter gains; Deutsche forecasts huge ad sales growth

    • Though Twitter (TWTR +2%) currently trades at 17x its consensus 2015 sales forecast, Deutsche's Ross Sandler (Buy, $60 target) estimates shares go for only 5.7x 2017 sales, assuming Twitter's ad load and prices end up matching those for Facebook's mobile news feed ads. He considers the ad price assumption conservative.
    • Sandler adds Twitter can boost engagement (and with it, ad sales) for the 500M+ monthly unique visitors who aren't logged in by algorithmically creating "unique 'logged off' user experiences." He observes the average logged-off user only visits Twitter 1-2 times/day; those logged in visit 7 times/day.
    • Shares are near their highest levels since March on a down day for equities. JPMorgan upgraded last Thursday.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • ISCA

    More on International Speedway's FQ3

    • Shares of International Speedway (ISCA -5.1%) slide despite the company topping earnings estimates with its FQ3 report.
    • Admissions revenue +3.5% to $26.27M.
    • Motorsports revenue +2.7% to $81.99M.
    • G&A expenses +2.7% to $28.19M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM

  • 10-year Treasury yield erases post-Labor Day advance

    • The 10-year Treasury yield declined all summer, but that was wiped away in the three weeks following Labor Day as it shot higher to about 2.62%. With today's four basis point decline to 2.38%, that September advance has now been erased.
    • The impressive move down comes against a backdrop of a FOMC seemingly intent on hiking rates by early next summer, and last Friday's employment report showing the unemployment rate falling all the way to 5.9%.
    • Amid the handy excuses for headline writers are slipping stocks - the S&P 500 is down about 0.5% - German 10-year yields are all the way down to 0.87%, and the IMF cutting its global growth forecast.
    • TLT +0.5%, TBT -1%
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, SBND, TLH, DLBS, VGLT, UBT, TLO, TENZ, LBND, TYBS, DLBL
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 9 Comments
  • CBMX

    CombiMatrix jumps on increase on prenatal testing

    • Shares of thinly-traded nano cap CombiMatrix (CBMX +17.4%) rise on light volume in response to its announcement that Q3's prenatal testing volume will be up 71% yoy. Total microarray testing volumes for the quarter are expected to be up 24%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • RIO

    Glencore confirms it is no longer considering merger with Rio Tinto

    • Rio Tinto (RIO -4.1%) drops sharply after Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF, OTCPK:GLNCY) states it is no longer interested in pursuing a combination with Rio.
    • Glencore says it will be subject to Rule 2.8 of the City Code on Takeovers and Mergers for six months in relation to Rio while reserving the right to make an offer in the future.
    • Rio had said earlier that it rejected a Glencore bid in August and that no discussions are taking place.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon +9.6% on Apple speculation

    • With GT Advanced having filed for bankruptcy, speculation that Rubicon's (NASDAQ:RBCN) sapphire materials could be used to pick up the slack has grown
    • Though best known for its wafers, a page on Rubicon's site notes the company also provides 2" sapphire ingots for camera lens cover and biometric applications, as well as "rectangular blocks ready to be sliced  into smartphone faceplates and custom shapes such as smart-watch face plates." (h/t Notable Calls)
    • Also: If GT Advanced's sapphire capacity was removed from the market (remains to be seen), Rubicon could benefit from the diminished industry supply even in the absence of an Apple deal.
    • Apple is using sapphire cover glass for two of its three smartwatch models, but opted against using it on the iPhone 6, reportedly due to technical shortcomings.
    • Rubicon has recovered most of the Monday losses it saw in response to GT's filing. Shares dove to a new 52-week low of $3.56 yesterday before bouncing.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • CMI

    Weak day for truck stocks

    • Cummins (CMI -3.8%), Navistar (NAV -5.3%), and PACCAR (PCAR -1.8%) slide lower in early trading.
    • A decision by Daimler to sell medium-duty engines in the U.S. beginning in 2016 could be a factor.
    • A downgrade on Cummins to Neutral from Buy is also in the mix.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • GLUU

    Glu dips on bearish report from TheStreetSweeper

    • Kim Kardashian: Hollywood "has taken a dramatic free-fall" in iPhone download charts, writes TheStreetSweeper in a bearish report on Glu Mobile (GLUU -1.9%). The site notes the Kardashian game has fallen to #163 on App Annie's U.S. free iPhone download chart; it was at #69 early in September.
    • The game is still at #5 on the U.S. iPhone top-grossing chart, and respectively at #29 and #15 on App Annie's U.S. Google Play free and top-grossing download charts.
    • TheStreetSweeper also dismisses last week's Facebook launch for the Kardashian game. "Nobody plays games on Facebook anymore," one mobile game analyst is quoted as saying. That's a bit of an exaggeration.
    • Also mentioned: Insiders have sold nearly $1.5M worth of shares since Aug. 1, and Amazing Battle Creatures and Racing Rivals aren't faring well on iPhone download charts. The latter was obtained through the Cie Games acquisition.
    • Shares have fallen moderately on the report. The Nasdaq is down 0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 8 Comments
  • DE

    Deere lower on BofA/Merrill downgrade

    • BofA/Merrill has downgraded Deere (DE -1.9%) to Underperform citing the collapse in corn and soybean pricing and the strengthening U.S. dollar.
    • The firm expects the collapse in farm equipment demand to hit hard in 2015 and lowered estimates 10%-20% below consensus.
    • PT lowered to $82 from $90.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 4 Comments
  • M

    ITG warns on Macy's

    • ITG is out with a warning on Macy's (M -0.8%).
    • The investment research firm forecasts that Macy's FQ3 (ending in Nov.) revenue is tracking below consensus on flat same-store sales growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • KCAP

    KCAP Financial -4.7% after pricing secondary

    • KCAP Financial (KCAP -4.7%) prices its 3M share secondary at $8.59 each, with the underwriters having an option to buy another 450K shares at that price.
    • The stock's early decline takes it to $8.19.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • MGM

    Wells Fargo forecasts weak revenue for Golden Week in Macau

    • Wells Fargo says revenue in Macau fell off 20% to 23% for the beginning part of Golden Week.
    • The forecast stands in contrast to a report yesterday that traffic was higher.
    • A higher mix of mass-market traffic over VIP traffic may account in part for the slide.
    • Decliners: MGM -0.9%, LVS -3.0%, Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) -2.4%, Melco Crown (MPEL) -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 2 Comments
  • SIMO

    Silicon Motion +6.4%; Q3 results to beat guidance

    • Silicon Motion (NASDAQ:SIMO) now expects Q3 revenue to be up 23%-25% Q/Q, above prior guidance for 15%-20% growth.
    • Gross margin is expected to be in a 52%-53% range, above prior guidance of 50%-52%. Q2 GM was 52.2%.
    • Full Q3 results arrive on Oct. 29. SIMO has been seeing strong demand for its eMMC NAND flash controllers from Android OEMs, an has also been growing sales of SSD controllers and 4G RF transceivers.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • EFOI

    Energy Focus +25% on $7.9M order for U.S. Navy

    • Energy Focus (NASDAQ:EFOI) +25.4% premarket after announcing a $7.9M order for the U.S. Navy, the company's second large order for the Navy in less than a month.
    • EFOI says the order for its military LED retrofit tubes is expected to be delivered throughout H1 2015, and is the single largest in its history, topping the $7.7M order received in September.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • GSAT

    Globalstar sets Thursday call to address Kerrisdale; +7%

    • The conference call is set for Thursday at 4:30 PM ET, and will include prepared remarks followed by a Q&A session.
    • GSAT +7% premarket
    • Previously: Globalstar -10.3% after Kerrisdale releases short report
     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • XCO

    Exco Resources sells interests in Compass Production Partners for $118M

    • Exco Resources (NYSE:XCO) +10.6% premarket after saying it sold its 25% interest in Compass Production Partners to an affiliate of Harbinger Group (NYSE:HRG) for $118.75M.
    • XCO says the sale will help improve its balance sheet and simplify its corporate structure, and it plans to use the proceeds to reduce the revolving commitment under its credit agreement.
    • RBC lowers its XCO price target to $3 from $4 after the sale of the remaining conventional east Texas/north Louisiana and Permian assets, reducing its 2015-16 cash flow per share estimates by 11%-12% and NAV by 7% to reflect impacts of the transaction (Briefing.com).
     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM | 3 Comments
  • GMCR

    Watchful eyes on demand for cold beverage systems

    • Shares of Keurig Green Mountain (NASDAQ:GMCR) are higher in early action despite a soft read from SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) on demand for home beverage systems.
    • A strong initiation from Goldman Sachs on the stock is helping to offset any concerns on the category.
    • Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) has its eyes on the developments with its 10-year Keurig Cold partnership kicking off in 2015.
    • If it's true that PepsiCo (NYSE:PEP) and Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) have interest in SodaStream - there's some number-crunching going inside the C-suites there.
    • GMCR +2.1% premarket, SODA  -17.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM | 9 Comments
  • RIO

    Merger speculation boosts Rio Tinto in London, but merger far from certain

    • Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) is up more than 5% in London trading after the miner said a deal with Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF, OTCPK:GLNCY) was not in the best interests of shareholders, and there had been no contact between the companies since August.
    • Analysts caution that investors may be jumping in too swiftly, seeing the potential value of a deal but overestimating the likelihood of an agreement being struck.
    • Glencore has many reasons to chase Rio, and to not take the rejection in July as the final word, but the idea is less compelling for Rio, which sees itself as a specialist top-drawer miner with a marketing business attached, and views Glencore as the reverse.
    • A formal bid could face regulatory concerns in Australia, where Rio mines most of its iron ore and has a listing on the country’s stock exchange.
    • RIO -1% premarket after surging 9% in yesterday's trade.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM
  • SODA

    Sharp drop for SodaStream following Q3 warning

    • Shares of SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) come off their trading halt to show a double-digit loss following a stark warning from the company on Q3.
    • Grounded beverage industry analysts have been noting for a while that SodaStream's soft sales in the U.S. is the bigger story than takeover chatter.
    • SODA -15.9% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM
  • MCD

    McDonald's Japan sinks into the red

    • McDonald's Japan warns it expects a loss this year of ¥17B ($157M) which would mark the first loss for the restaurant operator in 11 years.
    • Escalating expenses and soft demand have hampered the company all year.
    • McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) owns 50% of the Japanese restaurant chain holding entity.
    • MCD -0.5% premarket
